unnormalised: Okay, so you're trying to find the right address for that Govt. office, huh? I know the struggle! Finding the exact address for government institutions and various other official buildings in India can feel like a proper treasure hunt, right? Especially when you only have a vague idea of where to look.
normalised: Okay, so you're trying to find the right address for that Government office, huh? I know the struggle! Finding the exact address for government institutions and various other official buildings in India can feel like a proper treasure hunt, right? Especially when you only have a vague idea of where to look.

unnormalised: First off, remember that the postal system is still a thing! So, knowing the correct pin code is super important, especially in sprawling cities like Delhi or Mumbai. You might get away with just using a landmark if you are really lucky and the postman knows the area well. In that case, "Near AIIMS, Delhi" might actually work as a portion of the address. But generally, always try to get the pin code.
normalised: First off, remember that the postal system is still a thing! So, knowing the correct pin code is super important, especially in sprawling cities like Delhi or Mumbai. You might get away with just using a landmark if you are really lucky and the postman knows the area well. In that case, "Near A-I-I-M-S, Delhi" might actually work as a portion of the address. But generally, always try to get the pin code.

unnormalised: Another thing I’ve noticed? The use of old and new names. For example, I remember trying to find this one government office in Chennai. Turns out, the address listed online was still using the old name of the street! So, always cross-reference the location with Google Maps or ask a local if you can.
normalised: Another thing I’ve noticed? The use of old and new names. For example, I remember trying to find this one government office in Chennai. Turns out, the address listed online was still using the old name of the street! So, always cross-reference the location with Google Maps or ask a local if you can.

unnormalised: And then there's the abbreviations! "Sector 15, Noida, UP" sounds simple enough, right? But sometimes, Govt. documents will abbreviate "Uttar Pradesh" as just "U.P." or even "UP". That can throw you off. Keep an eye out for these little inconsistencies. Also, make sure you get the building number correct. "Bldg. No. 10" could be completely different than "Bldg. 10A".
normalised: And then there's the abbreviations! "Sector fifteen, Noida, U-P" sounds simple enough, right? But sometimes, Government documents will abbreviate "Uttar Pradesh" as just "U-P" or even "U-P". That can throw you off. Keep an eye out for these little inconsistencies. Also, make sure you get the building number correct. "Building Number ten" could be completely different than "Building ten A".

unnormalised: Don't underestimate the power of landmarks either. If you can’t find an exact street number, "Opp. State Bank of India, MG Road, Bangalore" might be enough to get you close enough to ask for directions. Even better if you can include a very well known place, like "Near India Gate, New Delhi, 110001".
normalised: Don't underestimate the power of landmarks either. If you can’t find an exact street number, "Opposite State Bank of India, M-G Road, Bangalore" might be enough to get you close enough to ask for directions. Even better if you can include a very well known place, like "Near India Gate, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one".

unnormalised: Oh, and a quick word about RTO addresses. Those are notorious! They usually follow a very specific, sometimes confusing format. For instance, "RTO Office, Zone IV, Andheri (W), Mumbai - 400053" is pretty standard. Make sure you include the Zone number. That's important.
normalised: Oh, and a quick word about R-T-O addresses. Those are notorious! They usually follow a very specific, sometimes confusing format. For instance, "R-T-O Office, Zone four, Andheri (W), Mumbai - four hundred thousand and fifty three" is pretty standard. Make sure you include the Zone number. That's important.

unnormalised: Basically, finding government addresses in India is an art form. But with a little patience, a dash of local knowledge, and a whole lot of double-checking, you’ll get there! Good luck with your hunt!
normalised: Basically, finding government addresses in India is an art form. But with a little patience, a dash of local knowledge, and a whole lot of double-checking, you’ll get there! Good luck with your hunt!
